result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristin E. Marchese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sexual Exploitation by Therapist, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.
Spend 6 months in the county jail w/huber privileges (including child care), commencing 11/29/14 @ 8am.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. Defendant, Kristin E. Marchese, appeared with Attorney Joseph G. Easton.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Sentencing arguments made.    Sentence is withheld; Deft. placed on probation for 3 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 6 months in the KCJ commencing on 11/29/14 at 8:00 AM.  Huber authorized for Employment, Work Crew and Child Care.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Joseph Easton. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found.
